page.title: 03ENERGY
page.content: Aberangell has no mains gas supply so is entirely dependant upon mains electrcity for power. The village had its own private electricity supply (including 4 street lights), all powered by the mill race on the River Angell, long before many towns. But the inconsistency of water flow & the increased number & power of machines made this insufficient. With recent questioning of the safety of nuclear energy & growing awareness of the world's limited resoures a few farmers & householders examined the viability of reutilizing this water power, the scheme was blocked by a major land owner-MP. There is one house which has solar panels on the roof & a South- facing passive solar wall. The climate could be more favourable but it still heats much of the household's water.
